title: Organizational Ambidextrous Learning: Strategies for Creating Synergy Between Exploration and Exploitation

context.prior_knowledge: Basic organizational management theories and learning theory understanding
context.additional_context: Practitioner-targeted course applying organizational learning in language education; blended (online-offline) classroom environment with personal device utilization

learning_goals: Learners will explain the interaction principles of exploration and exploitation and apply them to organizational learning processes
Learners can connect the three processes of 'integrative ambidexterity' (innovation through memory, agility through focus, improvisation potential) to real-world cases
Learners will be able to design specific implementation plans to create synergy between exploration and exploitation in language education organizations
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
